issue.title: Is it compatible with cakephp 4.4.7 ?
issue.body:
I am trying to implement the plugin on cake version 4.4.7 and I found several incompatibilities.
Does this version is compatible with recent cakephp ?

Thank you

body: The issue seems to be that `use` and type declarations don't trigger autoloading. Hence `src/Datasource/PaginatorInterface.php` doesn't get loaded which contains the alias to the new interface `Cake\Datasource\Paging\PaginatorInterface` which the new paginator classes implement.

I remember that we once did
https://github.com/spryker/search/blob/446bccadfc8161e0151faf2ff48eb6074b17eadf/src/Spryker/Client/Search/Dependency/Plugin/ResultFormatterPluginInterface.php#L20
as that also solved similar issues.
Not sure if that applies here as workaround or so.

issue.title: Fix loading of old interface.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Closes #16867

<!---

Please describe the reason for the changes you're proposing. If it is a large change, please open an issue to discuss first.

Always follow the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) when submitting a pull request. In particular, make sure existing tests still pass, and add tests for all new behavior. When fixing a bug, you may want to add a test to verify the fix.

-->

body:
I wrote a small script that we could probably add to our CI process if it is without false positives

But in the meantime, shouldnt we fix then all potential issues here? Or which ones can be ignored?
```
Cake\Database\Driver\SqlDialectTrait
* Missing class alias on new file for Database/SqlDialectTrait.php => Cake\Database\Driver\SqlDialectTrait
Cake\Database\Exception\DatabaseException
* Missing class alias on new file for Database/Exception.php => Cake\Database\Exception\DatabaseException
Cake\Database\TypeFactory
* Missing class alias on new file for Database/Type.php => Cake\Database\TypeFactory
Cake\Core\Exception\CakeException
* Missing class alias on new file for Core/Exception/Exception.php => Cake\Core\Exception\CakeException
Cake\Datasource\Paging\NumericPaginator
* Missing class alias on new file for Datasource/Paginator.php => Cake\Datasource\Paging\NumericPaginator
Cake\Datasource\Paging\SimplePaginator
* Missing class alias on new file for Datasource/SimplePaginator.php => Cake\Datasource\Paging\SimplePaginator
Cake\Datasource\Paging\Exception\PageOutOfBoundsException
* Missing class alias on new file for Datasource/Exception/PageOutOfBoundsException.php => Cake\Datasource\Paging\Exception\PageOutOfBoundsException
Cake\Http\Exception\MissingControllerException
* Missing class alias on new file for Routing/Exception/MissingControllerException.php => Cake\Http\Exception\MissingControllerException
Cake\Controller\ControllerFactory
* Missing class alias on new file for Http/ControllerFactory.php => Cake\Controller\ControllerFactory
Cake\Error\ConsoleErrorHandler
* Missing class alias on new file for Console/ConsoleErrorHandler.php => Cake\Error\ConsoleErrorHandler
Cake\Command\Command
* Missing class alias on new file for Console/Command.php => Cake\Command\Command
```
I'm not sure what that's checking but there are aliases defined for DatabaseException.

Ah, some are using class_alias(), some class_exists()
That seems inconsistent and probably causing them the error if both are loaded, right?
The class_exists() check itself reveals this:
```
Cake\Database\Schema\SqlserverSchemaDialect
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/Schema/SqlserverSchemaDialect.php => Cake\Database\Schema\SqlserverSchemaDialect
Cake\Database\Schema\SchemaDialect
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/Schema/SchemaDialect.php => Cake\Database\Schema\SchemaDialect
Cake\Database\Schema\MysqlSchemaDialect
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/Schema/MysqlSchemaDialect.php => Cake\Database\Schema\MysqlSchemaDialect
Cake\Database\Schema\SqliteSchemaDialect
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/Schema/SqliteSchemaDialect.php => Cake\Database\Schema\SqliteSchemaDialect
Cake\Database\Schema\PostgresSchemaDialect
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/Schema/PostgresSchemaDialect.php => Cake\Database\Schema\PostgresSchemaDialect
Cake\Database\Driver\SqlDialectTrait
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/SqlDialectTrait.php => Cake\Database\Driver\SqlDialectTrait
Cake\Database\Expression\ComparisonExpression
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/Expression/ComparisonExpression.php => Cake\Database\Expression\ComparisonExpression
Cake\Database\Exception\DatabaseException
 * OK
Cake\Database\TypeFactory
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Database/Type.php => Cake\Database\TypeFactory
Cake\Core\Exception\CakeException
 * OK
Cake\Datasource\Paging\NumericPaginator
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Datasource/Paginator.php => Cake\Datasource\Paging\NumericPaginator
Cake\Datasource\Paging\SimplePaginator
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Datasource/SimplePaginator.php => Cake\Datasource\Paging\SimplePaginator
Cake\Datasource\Paging\Exception\PageOutOfBoundsException
 * OK
Cake\Datasource\Paging\PaginatorInterface
 * OK
Cake\Http\Exception\MissingControllerException
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Routing/Exception/MissingControllerException.php => Cake\Http\Exception\MissingControllerException
Cake\Controller\ControllerFactory
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Http/ControllerFactory.php => Cake\Controller\ControllerFactory
Cake\Error\ConsoleErrorHandler
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Console/ConsoleErrorHandler.php => Cake\Error\ConsoleErrorHandler
Cake\Command\Command
* Missing class_exists() on new file for Console/Command.php => Cake\Command\Command
```
They use both on purpose. class_alias generates the alias and class_exist loads the other file with the alias. We should call class_exist and class_alias consistently in the new and old file though.

I see, then one existing suffices? either alias or exists?
```
Cake\Database\Schema\SqlserverSchemaDialect
 * OK
Cake\Database\Schema\SchemaDialect
 * OK
Cake\Database\Schema\MysqlSchemaDialect
 * OK
Cake\Database\Schema\SqliteSchemaDialect
 * OK
Cake\Database\Schema\PostgresSchemaDialect
 * OK
Cake\Database\Driver\SqlDialectTrait
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Database/SqlDialectTrait.php => Database/Driver/SqlDialectTrait.php
Cake\Database\Expression\ComparisonExpression
 * OK
Cake\Database\Exception\DatabaseException
 * OK
Cake\Database\TypeFactory
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Database/Type.php => Database/TypeFactory.php
Cake\Core\Exception\CakeException
 * OK
Cake\Datasource\Paging\NumericPaginator
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Datasource/Paginator.php => Datasource/Paging/NumericPaginator.php
Cake\Datasource\Paging\SimplePaginator
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Datasource/SimplePaginator.php => Datasource/Paging/SimplePaginator.php
Cake\Datasource\Paging\Exception\PageOutOfBoundsException
 * OK
Cake\Datasource\Paging\PaginatorInterface
 * OK
Cake\Http\Exception\MissingControllerException
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Routing/Exception/MissingControllerException.php => Http/Exception/MissingControllerException.php
Cake\Controller\ControllerFactory
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Http/ControllerFactory.php => Controller/ControllerFactory.php
Cake\Error\ConsoleErrorHandler
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Console/ConsoleErrorHandler.php => Error/ConsoleErrorHandler.php
Cake\Command\Command
* Missing class_exists() or class_alias() on new file for Console/Command.php => Command/Command.php
```

Neither of `SqlDialectTrait`, `TypeFactory`, `ControllerFactory` are going to be used in type declaration or instanceof checks. So the `class_exists()` call for their old versions isn't necessary, I'll make a PR for the rest.

issue.title: Add validation script not to miss deprecation aliases.

milestone.description: 4.5.0 can introduce new features and deprecations to be removed in 5.x. 4.5.0 will receive feature backports from 5.x where the core team or community think they will help future upgrade paths or don't rely on breaking changes. Community contributions are always welcome.

issue.body:
Refs https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/16965

Keeps our code base consistent and avoids accidental regressions ( https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/16867 ).


Currently all green here in 4.next, example output in 4.x for example:
![Screenshot from 2023-01-18 10-41-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39854/213137160-e91f900a-d028-4f00-9b5d-ca62c74ef54b.png)
